page.title: 01Melchbourne, Location
page.content: Melchbourne is a small village situated in the north western corner of the county of Bedfordshire. The surrounding countryside is gently undulating arable and parkland, which still retains many hedges and lovely woods. The major part of the village is one, no through road which ends in the drive of Melchbourne Park. The ages of the houses vary from thatched cottages to some recently constructed old peoples dwellings and two bungalows in the process of being built. The village hall and the church are along this road, but the public house, the St. John Arms is half a mile to the east. There are several farms and the Oakley Hunt Kennels close by..
